biography.value:
The students of Prismari College—first as Prismari apprentice;apprentices and then as pledgemages—see no distinction between magic and art. No two Prismari students have the same style of spellcasting; each wields the elemental magic taught by the college in a way that expresses their personality. In the hands of Prismari students, spells that conjure fire or bend water to one’s will become vibrant and expressive showcases, thrumming with creative energy.

Harnessing the elemental forces of their magic requires precision and grace, and some students dedicate themselves to chasing the ideal of perfect control, hoping that by doing so, they can accurately express what is churning within their minds.

Prismari Scholars

The scholars of Prismari College believe that art is the truest form of spellcraft. They use magic to make splendid art, and they employ artistry to make their magic spectacular.

description.value:
The pledgemage makes two &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Strike attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 3d6 + @mod -1 type=fire or cold average=true]] damage (the pledgemage’s choice).

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

The pledgemage shines with &Reference[elemental]{elemental} magic, targeting one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must make a [[/save wis 13 format=long]]. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 8d6 type=fire or cold average=true]] damage (the pledgemage’s choice) and is &Reference[stunned]{stunned} until the start of the pledgemage’s next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn’t &Reference[stunned]{stunned}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The pledgemage casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[cha]{Charisma} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

At will: minor &Reference[ill]{illusion}

2/day each: gust of wind, silent image

1/day each: mage armor, water walk

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Evasion. If the pledgemage is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw to take only half damage, the pledgemage instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn’t &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The pledgemage moves up to its speed, surrounding itself with &Reference[elemental]{elemental} magic as it moves. Until the end of its turn, the pledgemage can move through the space of other creatures. The first time the pledgemage enters a creature’s space on a turn, that creature must succeed on a [[/save dex 13 format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. If the pledgemage ends its turn in another creature’s space, the pledgemage takes [[/damage 1d10 type=force average=true]] damage and is pushed into the nearest unoccupied space.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The &Reference[ill]{illusion} also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object--such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest--it must be no larger than a 5-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an &Reference[ill]{illusion}, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an &Reference[ill]{illusion} with a successful &Reference[int]{Intelligence} (&Reference[inv]{Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the &Reference[ill]{illusion} for what it is, the &Reference[ill]{illusion} becomes faint to the creature.

A &Reference[line]{line} of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the spell's duration. Each creature that starts its turn in the &Reference[line]{line} must succeed on a &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the &Reference[line]{line}.

Any creature in the &Reference[line]{line} must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you.

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

As a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends, you can change the direction in which the &Reference[line]{line} blasts from you.

You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 15-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}. The image appears at a spot within range and lasts for the duration. The image is purely visual; it isn't accompanied by sound, smell, or other sensory effects.

You can use your action to cause the image to move to any spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an &Reference[ill]{illusion}, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an &Reference[ill]{illusion} with a successful &Reference[int]{Intelligence} (&Reference[inv]{Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the &Reference[ill]{illusion} for what it is, the creature can see through the image.

You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical &Reference[force]{force} surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

This spell grants the ability to move across any liquid surface--such as water, &Reference[acid]{acid}, mud, snow, quicksand, or lava--as if it were harmless solid ground (creatures crossing molten lava can still take damage from the heat). Up to ten willing creatures you can see within range gain this ability for the duration.

If you target a creature submerged in a liquid, the spell carries the target to the surface of the liquid at a rate of 60 feet per round.
